noun.description: Musical instruments played by striking with the hand or with a handheld or pedal-operated stick or beater, or by shaking, including drums, cymbals, xylophones, gongs, bells, and rattles.
The striking of one solid object with or against another with some degree of force.
examples: the clattering percussion of objects striking the walls and the shutters

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin percussio(n-), from the verb percutere to strike forcibly (see percuss).
